Package com.percussion.extensions.general

Class Summary
Base64Decoder This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
Base64Encoder This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSAddAllParamsToUrl This pre-exit adds all HTML parameters in the request to the specified URLs.
PSAddCurrentDateTime This class is a Rhythmyx pre-exit that adds the current date and time as an HTML parameter to the provided request.
PSAddIsManagedNavUsed This exit adds isManagedNavUsed=yes attribute to the root element of the result document if the managed navigation is configured (or the managed navigation properties file exists) for this server.
PSAddPluginProperties The purpose of the exit is to Choose the appropriate plug-in from the server configuration settings based on the client OS and Browser.
PSAddServerProperties This is a generic exit that adds a specfied list of properties from server.properties file as attributes to the root element of the result document.
PSAppendUserRoles This post-exit appends user roles to the root element of the result document as per the DTD below: <root> <UserRoles> <Role>Admin</Role> <Role>Author</Role> </UserRoles> </root> Also there is an optional parameter that can be supplied when we need to use a differnt element name for UserRoles in the above document.
PSBinaryChooser  
PSCascadeDelete This exit can be used for cascading delete operation, ie.
PSCollapseHtmlParameter This exit collapses the supplied list of HTML parameters (as exit parameters) in the request in that if it finds more than one value for the parameter, i.e.
PSCopyParameter This pre-exit copies a request parameter from the key specified by the source exit parameter to the key specified by the destination exit parameter
PSDateDifference UDF to parse two dates (or date strings) and return the absolute difference in days between the two dates.
PSFileInfo This class is a Rhythmyx pre-exit which examines the incoming HTML parameters for attached files.
PSFormatFileTree This class is a Rhythmyx ResultDocumentProcessor extension.
PSGetBase64Encoded This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSGetBase64EncodedBody This pre-exit is a derivative of the PSGetBase64Encoded with the only difference in that it only returns Base64 encoded BODY portion of the fetched HTML document.
PSGetFileSize This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSGetSessionVariable Rhythmyx pre-exit to fetch an session object and add it to request parameters.
PSImageInfoExtractor This class is a Rhythmyx pre-exit which examines the incoming HTML parameters for attached files.
PSIncrementalContentFilter Title: PSIncrementalContentFilter
PSInlineLinkCleanup This class is a Rhythmyx ResultDocumentProcessor extension.
PSMakeAbsLink This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSMakeAbsLinkSecure This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSMakeAbsLinkSecureEx This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSMakeDeleteRowsXmlDoc This extension builds a content item list for deletion by the Rhythmyx update resource.
PSMakeInternalRequest A UDF that makes an internal request to the specified resource and returns the result document.
PSMakeIntLink This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSMakeLink This class implements the UDF processor interface so it can be used as a Rhythmyx function.
PSMakeLinkTest  
PSNullIf Forces the named request parameters' values to null, when their current value is equal to a specified value.
PSParameterTokenizer A Rhythmyx pre-exit that tokenizes delimited input parameters into multiple lists for insert.
PSParamExtractor This exit extracts named parameters from the standard HTML parameter input document to HTML parameters with same names into the request.
PSParamsToXml This exit convertes the an array of specified HTML parameters to an XML format and useful when a request comes with an array of HTML params.
PSParamStringListToMultiParams Takes a parameter that contains a delimited string list and turns it into a multiple value parameter.
PSParamStringListToMultiParamsTest Unit test for the PSParamStringListToMultiParams exit.
PSPrepareInClause This Exit is used to take in a Collection and format the value portion of an "IN" clause, adding the resulting string to the reqeust as a specified HTML parameter.
PSQueryExtensions  
PSReplaceResultDocument This exit can be used where you need to execute condtional internal requests.
PSRhythmyxRoot UDF to get the rhythmyx request root.
PSSetArrayHtmlParameter Sets an HTML Parameter to the request with an array list of values.
PSSetHtmlParameter This pre-exit sets / creates or removes a single request parameter
PSSetSessionVariable Rhythmyx pre-exit to set a session object from a request parameter.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_add The PSSimpleJavaUdf_add class adds the 2 supplied numbers and returns the result.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_cloneTitle This UDF formats a content item title for a new clone.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_concat The PSSimpleJavaUdf_concat class concatenates two strings and returns the result.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateAdjust The PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateAdjust class updates the date according to the command of a corresponding user defined function (UDF) call.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormat The PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormat class formats a date according to a user supplied pattern.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormatEx The PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormatEx class formats a date according to a user supplied pattern.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormatTest Tests both versions: PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormat and PSSimpleJavaUdf_dateFormatEx.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_decodeURL The PSSimpleJavaUdf_decodeURL class Decodes a "x-www-form-urlencoded" to a String.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_divide The PSSimpleJavaUdf_divide class divides 2 numbers and returns the result.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_encodeForUrl Takes a string and encodes it so it is safe to use as a URL query param value.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_literal The PSSimpleJavaUdf_literal class converts literals given by a user defined function (UDF) to strings.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_multiply The PSSimpleJavaUdf_multiply class multiplies two numbers given by a user defined function (UDF).
PSSimpleJavaUdf_overrideLiteral This UDF converts the supplied parameter to a String and returns that or the override value supplied through the request parameters.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_replace The PSSimpleJavaUdf_replace class replaces strings given by a user defined function (UDF).
PSSimpleJavaUdf_subtract The PSSimpleJavaUdf_subtract class performs subtraction operation for two numbers given by a user defined function (UDF).
PSSimpleJavaUdf_toHash The PSSimpleJavaUdf_toHash class returns a hashcode for the object passed into the UDF.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_toLowerCase The PSSimpleJavaUdf_toLowerCase class converts strings given by a user defined function (UDF) to lower case.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_toProperCase The PSSimpleJavaUdf_toProperCase class converts strings given by a user defined function (UDF) to proper cases for each individual characters.
PSSimpleJavaUdf_toUpperCase The PSSimpleJavaUdf_toUpperCase class converts strings given by a user defined function (UDF) to upper case.
PSSimpleJavaUdfBaseTest  
PSSplitDateParam Splits supplied date into its components and sets as request parameters with specified parameter names.
PSStringTrimmerUdf Strips leading and trailing white space from the supplied string.
PSSuperConcat  
PSTextToXml Udf to parse an Xml fragment containing an element and return a Document with the specified root and the parsed element as a child of that root.
PSTouchContentAndParentItems This pre-exit recursively looks up 0 or more (active assembly) parent items of a given content.
PSTouchParentItems This workflow action touches all "active assembly parent" items of the current item.
PSUploadFileAttrs This class calculates the size of an uploaded file and appends an html parameter with current date value in a given date format.
PSValidateFile Validates that either no source file was supplied, null or empty, or that the content of the supplied file is not empty.
PSValidateString Checks if a string is empty, null, or whitespace.
